title: Elroy and the Aliens
description:
Step into the roles of Elroy, a brilliant rocket engineer haunted by his father’s mysterious disappearance eighteen years prior, and Peggie, a tenacious investigative reporter with a passion for languages, history, and uncovering the truth. Their adventure ignites with the discovery of a cryptic crystal and an enigmatic message, propelling them from their familiar home in Slope City into the vast expanse of the cosmos. Their intertwined destinies lead them on a heartwarming and humorous journey to locate Elroy’s long-lost father, all while unknowingly becoming entangled in a looming danger that threatens the very fabric of the universe.
This point-and-click adventure seamlessly blends classic gameplay mechanics with modern sensibilities, offering a captivating experience for both seasoned veterans and newcomers to the genre. Set in a quirky, alternate version of the 1990s, the world is populated by intelligent robots, touched by paranormal occurrences, and steeped in an ancient archaeological enigma. Players will switch between multiple playable characters, each with their own unique skills and perspectives, as they navigate a narrative rich in mystery, character development, ancient lore, alien languages, and playful nods to pop culture.
Their epic quest will span across two distinct planets and encompass over sixty diverse locations, introducing players to a vibrant cast of more than sixty memorable characters. The game boasts high-resolution, hand-drawn 2D art and animations, evoking a nostalgic old-school charm enhanced with modern polish. Fully voiced characters and an original musical score contribute to an immersive, cinematic feel. Designed with inclusivity in mind, the game offers helpful accessibility features such as captions for color-based puzzles, subtitles, and various input options. Prepare for an engaging gameplay experience estimated to last ten hours or more, depending on your individual pace and approach to solving the intriguing and challenging puzzles that lie ahead. Haste: Broken Worlds
